meanings.definition: Remove gum or sticky residue from (something).
meanings.sent1: I need to degum my shoe from the sticky gum on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She used a special spray to degum the table from the spilled soda.
meanings.sent3: Trying to degum a book from a library sticker can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The degumming process felt like peeling off layers of sticky memories.
meanings.sent5: After hours of scrubbing, she finally managed to degum the old poster from the wall.

meanings.definition: To remove gum or sticky residue.
meanings.sent1: He had to degum his hair after accidentally sitting on a piece of gum.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner used a solvent to degum the windows and make them sparkle.
meanings.sent3: It's always a hassle to degum the bottom of your shoe after stepping on gum.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter helped degum the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The warm water helped degum the sticky label from the jar effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The process of removing gum or sticky residue.
meanings.sent1: The degum of the old posters from the wall took hours of careful work.
meanings.sent2: After the degum, the table looked brand new without any sticky residue.
meanings.sent3: The degum of the stickers from the window was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent4: The degum of the tape revealed a clean surface underneath.
meanings.sent5: The degum of the label left a faint sweet scent in the air.
